Authors:
Rubén Félix-Gastélum, Guadalupe Arlene Mora-Romero, Ana
Valdéz-Leyva, Silvia Espinosa-Matías, Reyna Lara-Martínez, Karla Yeriana
Leyva-Madrigal
Title:
Wilsoniana sp. associated with white blister rust of
Amaranthus palmeri in Mexico
Abstract:
Morphological and phylogenetic analyses were conducted
with two white blister rust 19 specimens from Amaranthus palmeri
collected in Sinaloa, Mexico. Secondary sporangia 20 were similar to
those of W. bliti and W. amaranthi. The coarsely reticulate epispore of
the 21 oospores corresponded to W. amaranthi, although they were smaller
than those reported in 22 the same species on A. dubius. The diameter of
the oospores was similar to that in W. bliti 23 from A. blitum, whereas
the pattern of ornamentation did not correspond to this species. The 24
phylogenetic analysis confirms that both specimens belong to Wilsoniana
but do not 25 correspond to any accepted species within the genus, and
they have therefore been designated 26 as Wilsoniana sp. Future research
lines should focus on the description and taxonomic 27 position of
species in the genus Wilsoniana.

trees.title:
Maximum likelihood tree of the combined COX2 and ITS
sequences of white blister rust.
